identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of ON 123300 in Patients With Advanced Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: Phase 1 Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of ON 123300 Capsules Administered Orally as Escalating Daily Doses in Patients With Advanced Cancer Relapsed or Refractory to at Least One (1) Prior Line of Therapy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will investigate the safety of the drug ON 123300 at increasing doses to determine the best dose to use in future clinical trials.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
After being informed about the study including potential risks, patients giving written informed consent will proceed to a screening period when assessments will be performed to determine whether the patient is eligible to participate in the study. If the patient is eligible, they will start to receive ON 123300 as capsules every day. On day 1 and Day 8 of the study, patients will be required to provide eight blood samples to allow measurement of the amount of drug in their blood. Three ECGs will also be performed during this time. Patients will continue to receive ON 123300 until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or patient or physician decision to stop.

The first group of patients will receive 40mg of ON 123300 daily, the next group 80mg of ON 123300, the 120mg, etc. until the correct dose has been determined for future studies.

Patients will visit the clinic on Days 1, 2, 8, and 9, then weekly for the first month, then every two weeks for two more months, then every month.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: 3+3 dose escalation design with expansion cohort at recommended phase 2 dose

armGroups.label: ON 123300
armGroups.description: ON 123300 capsules at increasing doses per cohort, starting at 40 mg

primaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of protocol defined toxicities that would result in stopping dosing
Adverse events as measured by CTCAE version 5.0
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Consent to 30 days after last dose

primaryOutcomes.description: Changes and trends in standard hematology and chemistry blood tests
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Consent to 30 days after last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ON 123300 and 2 metabolites - Cmax
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Intense PK on Cycle1 Day1 and Day 8; Single samples pre-dose on Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1 (each cycle is 28 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ON 123300 and 2 metabolites - Tmax
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Intense PK on Cycle1 Day1 and Day 8; Single samples pre-dose on Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1 (each cycle is 28 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ON 123300 and 2 metabolites - AUClast
secondaryOutcomes.description: The area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) calculated to the last quantifiable sample
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Intense PK on Cycle1 Day1 and Day 8; Single samples pre-dose on Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1 (each cycle is 28 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ON 123300 and 2 metabolites - T1/2
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Intense PK on Cycle1 Day1 and Day 8; Single samples pre-dose on Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1 (each cycle is 28 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ON 123300 and 2 metabolites - CL/F
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Intense PK on Cycle1 Day1 and Day 8; Single samples pre-dose on Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1 (each cycle is 28 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ON 123300 and 2 metabolites - Vss
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Intense PK on Cycle1 Day1 and Day 8; Single samples pre-dose on Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1 (each cycle is 28 days)

otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months

locations.facility: Greenville Health System, Institute for Oncology Clinical Research
